page.title: 02DYKE VILLAGE 1945
page.content: { In 1945 there were about 30 houses in Dyke.Water was pumped daily to three wells and the school from a reservoir by means of a windpump.There was no electricity.In the school were three classes,each with about 20 pupils ages ranged from 5-14. Dances,concerts,clubs took place in the village hall.Quoits and tennis were played outside.There was one general store andbaker and butcher vans visited regularly.Ablacksmith and a joiner worked at the bottom end of the village but there was no pub.there was a private bus but very few cars.The school supplied bicycles on loan to those pupils who lived more than two and a half miles away.One man still drove in a horse and a cart to church.
